title: TOP 10 TIPS FOR YOUR TRACTOR'S 3 POINT HITCH!

tasks.task: Hooking up three-point attachments on a tractor.
subtasks: Ensure the tractor is in park and turned off.
Check if the ground is level; adjust attachments' placement if necessary.
Use a pallet to raise the attachment for easier handling and reduced strain.
Align the center link of the three-point hitch with the top pin position.
Attach the lower links first, adjusting as needed to align with the pins.
Raise the machine slightly to position the upper link for attachment.
Secure the top link, adjusting the angle as needed for the specific attachment.
For hydraulic top and side link systems, use the operator station controls to adjust the hitch's angle and side-to-side balance.
Consider using a hitch assist system for easier manual operation.
For PTO shaft connections, lock the PTO select lever in the correct position (rear, mid, or both) to facilitate proper engagement.
Mechanical PTO engagement requires manually aligning the splines and securing the collar/button once aligned.
Discuss the benefits of quick hitches (efficient attachment/unattachment, easier installation).
Explain how to connect a quick hitch: inserting the arms into the rear three-point hitch, aligning the top link, and securing any necessary bushings.
Highlight compatibility with standard ASAE specifications for ASAE-compliant attachments.
